greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of 5th power nonresidues modulo n.
comment: a(n) is the number of values r, 0<=r<n, such that, for p=5 and for any m>=0, (m^p)%n != r.
link: Stanislav Sykora, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
formula: Satisfies a(n) <= n-3 (residues 0, 1, and n-1 are always present).
results.author: _Stanislav Sykora_, Apr 19 2015
